definition: to hit the market (of a new product)
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
variant of 麵|面[mian4]
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc
market/city/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: A hatchback and a SUV will quickly follow.
sentences.chinese: 紧随其后，一款两厢车和SUV车型将面市。

sentences.english: A new edition, revised by a woman, arrives this month.
sentences.chinese: 由一位女性修正的新版本上个月面市了。

sentences.english: The watch will go on general sale in 2012.
sentences.chinese: 这款智能手表将于2012年面市。

sentences.english: He said the potato peeling packages may appear on shelves within 18 months.
sentences.chinese: 他表示，土豆皮做成的包装袋将于18个月内面市。

sentences.english: Although the laser pointer has been on the market for several years, use have been limited.
sentences.chinese: 激光笔已面市好几年了，但它的使用范围有限。

sentences.english: It is expected to reach the market by 2012.

definition: to be published (of art, literary works etc)/to come out/to take shape/to see the light of day
to be published/to come out
to put sth on the market
to push out/to release/to launch/to publish/to recommend
to sell well/hot-selling
to hit the market (of a new product)/to float (a company on the stock market)
to sell strongly/to be in great demand
to be completely sold out/to sell out
to sell
to respond to the market/to buy or sell according to market conditions
new product
advance sale/to sell in advance/to book
goods/merchandise/product/CL:個|个[ge4]
to confess one's crime/first model, version, kind etc (of gadgets, software, cars etc)
to sell out
to put into production/to put into operation
